replies.commentBody: And that makes it okay?

comments.commentBody: Well the Washington Post says Sessions met with the Russian ambassador, Sessions said he didn't, eventually the truth will out.  As far as the Russians interfering with our elections that shouldn't really be a surprise, we've been interfering with elections in foreign countries since shortly after WW2.  So a little blowback here.

Yet let's shower praise on our "Presidential" leader who toned down his hateful rhetoric for one hour last night. This is not normal. This will never be normal. When is the GOP Congress ever going to investigate? It's beyond comprehension what the reaction would be if any of this treasonous behavior originated from Hillary Clinton and her administration.

replies.commentBody: There has never been so obvious a con artist and psychopath as Donald Trump in the whole history of US politics.
Especially a stench manufactured by the outgoing prrsidential staff..
Quite wrong. You're believing too much of your boy's fake news. Sad.

comments.commentBody: Has there ever been a new administration which had such a stench about it?

replies.commentBody: This administration is a snow job alright. Trump's connection to Putin is another kind of job.

comments.commentBody:
My Armenian grandmother (immigrated to this country escaping the Armenian genocide) frequently would say in response to "stuff" like this:

You can't cover $hit with snow.

It's a useful saying that I have brought to bear on both business and personal situations. As a child, the substance of the comment is lost. However as our interface with the human experience grows, so does our understanding of this aphorism.

Apt, methinks. We've a large pile. We've much snow. Ocean levels will rise.

replies.commentBody: Another bit of news *not* about Trump are the anti-Semitic attacks.

Translation: you claim that foreign nations can engage in cyberwar to affect the American elections AND that candidates are free to collude with them to do so.

Go read the law. Wait and see what happens.

comments.commentBody:
I am heartened by a better balance than usual among comments to an article (in the NYT) about Russia.

Oh, this is about Trump?

I could have sworn it was about Russia. See, if the one thing that all such articles have in common is that there is a suspected involvement of Russia in American politics, then that (not Trump) is the real topic.

So, then, it is reasonable to ask "Why all the sudden interest in Russian involvement, when we routinely inquire as to the opinions of Europeans regarding our national elections and other domestic affairs?"

Russians are not allowed to do in secret what other nations do openly -- what, moreover, we do openly in fiddling with the internal matters of other nations -- including Russia?

Sorry, I'm not buying it. The Russians are entitled to meddle to their hearts' content. More power to them.

To anyone still whining about their epic loss in November, I say "Get in the game."

But "get in the game" doesn't mean merely complaining about other teams.

replies.commentBody: The Electoral College systematically nullifies a majority of all votes cast in every US presidential election. This must be fixed before the next one.
Can Congress demand that the tax returns be released?  The dud has been SO secretive about them to make anyone think there's something suspicious going on!

comments.commentBody:
These are strange times, indeed. Never would I have thought that an American president would align himself with Russia's Putin by saying that the USA does "bad things" too, thereby establishing some sort of "false equivalence".

I've been around and have witnessed a number of significant national and international events over the course of my lifetime, chief among them, "détente" in the 1970s, first with China and followed shortly thereafter with the Soviet Union. It helped to make the world a much safer place in which to live. But détente did in no way entail selling the soul of our country -- those essential values and principles that we hold so dear.

So to hear Trump establish some sort of false equivalence between the USA and Putin's Russia was shocking and only served to further illustrate that Trump is not qualified -- intellectually, emotionally, and spiritually -- to be our President.

The morning after the election, I was shocked to hear that he had won. And it is now becoming clear how he had managed to pull out that victory. He can thank his "good friend" Putin in large part, and the Republican Party which has done everything in its power to make voting more and more difficult for those who typically vote Democratic.

One thing is absolutely clear. It is imperative that Trump release his tax returns, just as all of our Presidents have done over the past 40 years. I'm sure it will tell quite a story and, in the process, answer many of our questions.

replies.commentBody: The Times is not "being used". They are very willing partners.

comments.commentBody: Has anyone given any thought to the 'coincidence' that this story appears the morning after Trump has had, to quote the always 'objective' Glen Thrush,their best news cycle of the first 41 days.  Any thought being given to the notion that the NYT is being used, or worse, with folks whose interest s to spread 'noise' in an effort to simple delegitimize Trump and stop his agenda from going anywhere.  Why are we not seeing more penetrating questions of the folks providing info on what in in the intelligence; are the reporters actually seeing the intelligence? For example, as was asked in an earlier post, who are the 'associates' of Trump.  My God, that could be thousands of individuals. I think it is time for the nYT to do some harder work on this story than just simply 'reporting/repeating' a story line provided by folks with what must be said are biased motives.  The hard questioning needs to go in both directions - to Trump and his accusers.

People on both sides, pro-Trump and against him, already know who the contacts were, when the discussions ocurred, how frequently they ocurred, and probably some bits of the discussions. What can it mean that it doesn't out? The intelligence on Flynn did.

Is the evidence of contacts leading up to and during the campaign still inconclusive? Or are Trump's opponents just waiting for the right politcal moment?

replies.commentBody: Just like the way Republicans were humbled after all those Benghazi investigations turned up nothing. Going hat in hand to Obama. It was downright embarrassing.

The Russian who died was Vitaly Churkin, the ambassador to the United Nations.
The Russian ambassador to the United States, Sergey Kislyak, is the one that AG, then Senator Sessions met with.

It was Russia's ambassador to the UN, Vitaly Churkin, who died last month, NOT
Sergey I. Kislyak, the Russian ambassador to the United States. You can't even tell the difference, and we're supposed to take you seriously?

comments.commentBody:
If this scandal turns out to be much ado about nothing, then the Democrats will have further alienated themselves from the Trump admin and the Republican party.

Compromises on serious legislation that could possibly benefit the left will happen only when Democrats come to the President with hat in hand and that's never a good negotiating position.

The left is betting on along shot. And if Sessions' conversations with the Russian ambassador — who recently died ( more drama) — were nothing more than business as usual for a member of the Senate Armed Services Committee, then the Democrats are going to look very stupid and highly compromised themselves.

replies.commentBody:
Madam: Ms. Clinton won the popular vote by 3 million. So yes, it is absurd to claim, as you note, that the Russians "controlled" the elections.

But that is not the point of this discussion. When the attorney general of the USA thinks that he can get away with ambiguous and misleading responses to direct questions from Congress, that is cause for investigation and inquiry -- intellectual phenomena with which you and other supporters of Mr. Trump may well be unfamiliar.

Russians have been and are trying to meddle in elections to weaken States. That is why Several European countries are girding themselves against that possibility by going to all paper ballots in upcoming elections. Do you really want an enemy country influencing our election?  At a minimum the Russians  preyed on the gullible in our country by strategically pouring fake news (anti Hillary, pro trump falsehoods) into our social media. This information comes from intelligence sources, not "lefty" groups.
Is this fake news?

comments.commentBody: It is amazing the insanity that these left wing boneheads will believe.  They believe that the Russians have the power to control the result of American national elections.  I would hope that if anyone could control the outcome it would be American politicians as much as I cannot stand them.  The underlying claim is absolutely goofy.  The Russians cannot control the outcome of a US election any more than I can or Hillary and her Democrats can.  It is ludicrous from the outset and then to carry it over to the Donald is even more nonsense.  Folks, someone has to stop these lefties stories or we will be hearing about how the Man in the Moon controls US elections!

We clearly do not have the information we need to explain the relationship between Trump and Putin. There simply must be something else there, otherwise none of this makes sense. I hope we find out what it is.

replies.commentBody: Sounds to me like they just left the bread crumbs... but say what you like.. the dominoes just keep falling now... All of us "losers" are just sitting back with popcorn

What about all the information held back by Trump and his cabinet members? So many of them, too many in fact, had their sticky fingers in the Russian pie.
Both Trump and Sessions have not shown much integrity in the past, so I don't know how it could be damaged. Republicans knew this and confirmed Trump's cabinet of rogues, just because of their party affiliation. Slap a "R" on it and all is well.

When the person "expressing some political overreach in Obama's farewell sanctions against Russia" is an appointee for a prominent position in the incoming White House staff, as Flynn was, it is critical for him to avoid seeming to undercut the current administration's actions.

comments.commentBody: There is a world of difference between pre-election contacts related to DNC emails and post-election contacts expressing some political overreach in Obama’s farewell sanctions against Russia. President Obama and his cronies obviously knew all the details as they occurred. They could not use the information to change the election but they could, and did, save the poison to impeach the integrity of Flynn, Sessions and Trump, just as Trump is climbing in the polls. The intentional and contrived abuse of top secret information for political purposes is worse than the fake news outlets that spin the story and profit from it, and perhaps even worse than Russia’s non-violent meddling in the world’s political affairs.

replies.commentBody: We know what the Russians have on Trump. What do the Russians have on our Congress members on both sides of the aisle? They must have something. I have never seen such a pack of traitors.

I suspect that there are many Dems in Congress that are placating and "making nice" with their Republican colleagues on the Russian issue so that they can bring their barrels of pork home to their districts.  Indiana ? Nuff said.

comments.commentBody:
I wrote my congressman Andre Carson, Democrat from Indiana (Indianapolis area) requesting a strong response to the trump administration's treatment of "Russiagate".

After a long list of the events warranting one my congressman said:

Despite these significant challenges, I agree with those who believe it is in our best interests to repair relations with Russia. As nuclear powers and permanent members of the United Nations Security Councils, the United States and Russia have the unique ability to promote international stability and peace. We cannot and should not sacrifice our values to accommodate Russian aggression. But it is important for us to keep the lines of communication open, to pressure Russia to comply with international law, to generally deescalate tensions between our two countries.

I felt with democrats like this, who needs republicans to let sneaky Russian style infiltration.

It also shows how cowed democrats in the house to make sure they know what we do, that this is Watergate--on steroids and appropriate action must be taken and now.

replies.commentBody: Don't Blame Obama for the GOPs love of the Kremlin.

comments.commentBody:
Explain why it is never" confirmed sources".
Additionally why if we are dealing with verifiable facts, that the prior administration did not release pertinent information before the election.

replies.commentBody:
Sessions didn't say "I met with the Russian Ambassador twice, I had no discussions about the campaign."

Had he said that, he would not have perjured himself ... but there surely would have been the following question: "what did you talk about?"

And he might have then perjured himself on that one.

Sessions is now proven to have perjured himself. It's equal to "no sex with that woman" and he's trying to wiggle out the same way.

Sessions may end up getting impeached too ... we'll see.

You might want to check the legal definition  of perjury. What Sessions said was not perjurious but was not fully accurate. AG Lynch met with President Clinton, denied discussing the case of Hillary (believe that and I have a bridge for you) and Schumer and Pelosi did not call for her to resign. She recused herself, as did Sessions, from the proceedings.

comments.commentBody: The other day I heard President Trump say he believed former President Obama was behind the attempt to link him and his campaign to the effort to defeat Hillary Clinton. I thought he was being paranoid but it appears he was on target. The matter of AG Scissions appears to be innuendo and I think Sessions meant what he said; namely he had no communications with the Russians about the campaign. President Obama demanded and received a complete report from the intelligence agencies BEFORE he left office, received it and released its findings. There was no evidence, in that report, of collusion between the Trump campaign and the election. The current administration would be foolish to have still another investigation by the DOJ or a special prosecutor which would dominate the news. They should concentrate on the economy, immigration, and ISIS. They should also not revisit the matter of whether Hillary Clinton violated the statute on releasing classified material or obstructed justice. There's a saying about beating a dead horse.

replies.commentBody:
And if the Benghazi Liar’s administration has nothing to hide then an independent council would also be warranted for the IRS, Crooked Hillary, the FBI and the NSA.

Please bring it on. Sunshine remains the best disinfectant for political crooks - of all stripes.

comments.commentBody: If the Trmp administration has nothing to hide, they would welcome a thorough, independent investigation, period. The intensity of their protestations is revealing.

replies.commentBody: tempus fugetaboudit?

comments.commentBody:
The Russian Effect has not been quantified in any way, the initial email releases showing the insider-DNC -anti Sanders tactics were apparently aimed at
the voter discontent with ‘the Establishment’ and thus affecting the Clinton inclined voters in the general election outcome.
Did Sanders’ voters refuse to turn over to Clinton voters resulting from those revelations-- any evidence, the assumption being most would have come out for the eventual Democratic candidate? A tempus in a tea pot?

Trump, along with his coterie of rightwing advisers and nominees, has made a virtue of hurling rocks at perceived critics and enemies, apparently oblivious to the fact that the election has installed them  in the world's biggest proverbial glass house. How dumb can they be not to realize that their dirt is bound to be forensically excavated, sorted, analyzed, and revealed for what it is for years to come -- or is it just boundless hubris combined with personal opportunism?

replies.commentBody: Sounds like you're OK that the integrity of our elections and legal system are being undermined by Russia. What a patriot.
Sounds like wishful thinking on your part. President Obama is a smart man and was well aware the popular vote loser could hang himself with his own noose.

If you had been keeping up with real facts, you would know that Mitch Traitor McConnell warned Pres. Obama that if he announced the Russian meddling back in September 2016, that he would be politicizing the election, so President Obama withheld the evidence and announcement.  In the same meeting was no other than James Comey, himself. Who only one month later, made the sham announcement that they found more "suspicious" emails on Anthony Weiner's laptop which amounted to zero.

comments.commentBody: Sounds like none of the "evidence" added up to anything or Obama would have released it before the election.

Any Republican lawmaker who opposes a through and impartial investigation of these allegations may find themselves accused as being a party to this all.
And have that placard hung around their neck. Lets hope the scaffold isn't too crowded.
Enough with the quevelling, start planning how you are going to participate, in body and wallet, in a get out the vote drive in a red state.
It's the only significant thing most of us plebes can do.
And boy, does red state ever have a new meaning.

replies.commentBody: The dnc hacks were in June. Why did they wait until.december to investigate?

comments.commentBody: Anybody paying attention would not be surprised by this news.  Obama initiated an investigation of Russia's tampering in December.  There is no way that investigation could have been completed before the Trump inauguration.  So extraordinary measure had to be taken.  Put yourself in Obama's shoes.  He's got no idea whether all the brouhaha is just smoke or whether it evidences the most serious election scandal in our history.  As the outgoing President, he would have been lax if he had not done what he could to facilitate a through investigation.  The man had no choice.
Look where we were ... look how far we've fallen

replies.commentBody: This will be a thousand cuts. There must be a steady drumbeat over time, not one bombshell that gets twitter frittered.

comments.commentBody: I do believe the gist of these accusations, and that Sessions lied under oath. On the other hand, I'd like to see the Times hold off on the larger story until it's gathered an absolutely critical mass of evidence. If the story's not a slam dunk, the current administration will continue to deny and distract, and the American people will find that the narrative is just a background hum that's easily ignored.

I smell smoke and I see fire.  The mere fact that there were contacts between Trump aides and Russian officials during the campaign is more than enough for an independent, full scale investigation.  Who do you think the independent investigator should be?

replies.commentBody: Wow.  Just Wow.
It is so frightening for the future of our republic that there are people like you that believe that garbage
Brian Williams?  That's rich!

comments.commentBody:
FINALLY THE MEDIA IS GOING AFTER RUSSIA'S INTERFERENCE IN OUR ELECTION.

Thanks to the New York Times for this stellar investigative reporting. Thanks to President Obama and his administration for spreading intelligence information out among agencies and giving it the lowest security classification possible so it can't be squelched by The Con Don and his Top 1% Global Financial Elite Robber Baron/ Radical Religion Good Old Boys' Party.

Thanks to the New Yorker for their excellent articles on the theme.

Thanks to Brian Williams and the other hosts of MSNBC for their 2-hour special last night on the Trump-Russia connection and for their inclusion of this NY Times Story, the recent New Yorker article and the Washington Post story on the same theme. (Rachel Maddow was off but she was the front runner on reporting on this theme. Thanks, Rachel!)

Ladies and Gentlemen, this is what it will take to stop the Robber Barons from destroying democracy in America and around the world. This is the America WE want to know about/ hear about along with efforts being made to SAVE democracy across America - not destroy it further.

This morning I have more HOPE than at any time since the nearly 5 MILLION PEOPLE STRONG Women's March on Washington, America and the World. TOGETHER WE CAN SAVE THE AMERICA WE LOVE.
